1:
Give ear to my prayer, God;\q and do not hide yourself from my plea.
\q
2:
Pay attention to me and answer me;\q I have no rest in my troubles
\q
3:
because of the voice of my enemies,\q because of the oppression of the wicked;
\q for they bring trouble on me
\q and persecute me in anger.


\q
4:
My heart trembles within me,\q and the terrors of death have fallen on me.
\q
5:
Fearfulness and trembling have come on me,\q and horror has overwhelmed me.


\q
6:
I said, "Oh, if only I had wings like a dove!\q Then would I fly away and be at rest.
\q
7:
See, then I would wander far away;\q I would stay in the wilderness.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
8:
I would hurry to a shelter\q from the stormy wind and tempest."
\q
9:
Devour them, Lord, confuse their language!\q For I have seen violence and strife in the city.


\q
10:
Day and night they go about on its walls;\q iniquity and mischief are in the middle of it.
\q
11:
Wickedness is in the middle of it;\q oppression and deceit do not leave its streets.


\q
12:
For it was not an enemy who rebuked me,\q then I could have borne it;
\q neither was it he who hated me who raised himself up against me,
\q then I would have hidden myself from him.
\q
13:
But it was you, a man equal to myself,\q my companion and my close friend.
\q
14:
We had sweet fellowship together;\q we walked in the house of God with the throng.


\q
15:
Let death come suddenly on them;\q let them go down alive to Sheol,
\q for wickedness is where they live, right among them.


\q
16:
As for me, I will call on God,\q and Yahweh will save me.
\q
17:
In the evening, morning and at noonday I complain and moan;\q he will hear my voice.
\q
18:
He will safely rescue my life from the battle that was against me,\q for those who fought against me were many.


\q
19:
God, the one who rules from eternity,\q will hear them and humiliate them.
 \qs Selah\qs*
\q They never change,
\q and they do not fear God.


\q
20:
My friend has raised his hands against those who were at peace with him;\q he has not respected the covenant that he had.
\q
21:
His mouth was smooth as butter,\q but his heart was hostile;
\q his words were softer than oil,
\q yet they were actually drawn swords.


\q
22:
Place your burdens on Yahweh, and he will sustain you;\q he will never allow a righteous person to totter.
\q
23:
But you, God, will bring the wicked down into the pit of destruction;\q bloodthirsty and deceitful men will not live even half as long as others,
\q but I will trust in you.
